intro: Neuropeltis anomala, commonly known as the African nettle, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes many stinging plants. The plant is characterized by its alternate, ovate leaves with short, soft hairs and small, inconspicuous greenish-white flowers. It typically grows as an erect herb or shrub, often reaching heights of up to 1 meter. The plant is known for its medicinal properties and is used in traditional African medicine for various ailments.
